type_.description: a human readable explanation of the error.
type_.title: Error Type

info.description:
Welcome to the SaltyBoy API. You are welcome to integrate with this API however please 
bear in mind the following:

- I'll do my best to not bork your integration by updating the endpoints, no promises 
    though.
- Do not abuse the API. By this I mean feel free to scrape in short high bursts but 
    don't spam the API with something in a constant `while` loop for example. After all 
    this runs on a very cheap Vultr instance :)
- If you want new endpoints or a Database dump please ping me on 
    [Github](https://github.com/FranciscoAT/saltyboy). I'm more than happy to review MRs
    for new features and provide PostgreSQL DB dumps.
- The API itself is extremely small so I won't be providing an SDK but there's no 
    authentication and it should be really easy to integrate around it.
- Any datetime strings should be returned in 
    [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.
info.title: SaltyBoy API

get.description: Returns the details of the current match from SaltyBet.</br></br>This can be a bit of a volatile endpoint that can be hard to integrate with so you</br>need to be aware of the following:</br></br>- `fighter_blue` and `fighter_red` reference the **name** and not the ID of the</br>    Fighter. While these fields per the schema _can_ have `null` values in my</br>    experience I've never seen this.</br>- If either `fighter_blue` or `fighter_red` are in the database the respective field</br>    `fighter_blue_info` or `fighter_red_info` will be filled out otherwise will be</br>    `null`.</br>- `fighter_blue_info` and `fighter_red_info` are just the standard Fighter model</br>    found in the `GET /api/fighter/` endpoints. However, in them will be a new field</br>    `matches` which will list **all** matches in the database associated with the</br>    `fighter_red` or `fighter_blue` Fighter of the current match.</br>- `match_format` contains the format of the current match. Important to note that if</br>    the match format is exhibition then it is always the case that</br>    `fighter_blue_info` and `fighter_red_info` will have `null` values, as SaltyBoy</br>    does not record exhibition matches.</br>- `tier` contains the tier of the match. Note that in exhibition matches it is very</br>    probable that this value is `null`. However, in tournament or matchmaking</br>    matches you can be very confident that this value will not be `null`.</br>- `updated_at` should always contain the date time at which the content for this</br>    endpoint was updated. Note that this time should roughly correlate with the</br>    time where Waif4u bot announces "Bets are open..." in the Twitch chat.</br>- This endpoint is known to go out of date due to the following reasons, and that</br>    your integration should code defensively and anticipate this endpoint going out</br>    of date:</br>    - The upstream bot that scrapes Twitch chat ran into an unrecoverable error.</br>        Although worth noting that this does not happen much if at all anymore.</br>    - Waif4U bot goes down in Twitch chat. Also an extremely rare occurrence.

Lists Fighters in a paginated format.</br></br>**Elo and Tier Elo**</br></br>SaltyBoy stores and upkeeps a self tracked version of ELO and Tier ELO. When a</br>fighter is first detected by SaltyBoy the ELO is set to 1500. SaltyBoy then uses</br>a K value of 32 to do ELO update calculations. Tier ELO similarly is set to 1500</br>and uses the same K value of 32. However, Tier Elo is reset to 1500 when a fighter</br>is  detected to have changed tiers, either up or down.</br></br>**Tier and Previous Tier**</br></br>SaltyBoy keeps track of the current tier of the fighter. It is important to note</br>that the real tier of the fighter may not be reflected in SaltyBoy until it sees the</br>fighter again. At which point the tier of the fighter is updated, and the Tier ELO</br>is also reset as per the above section.

get.description: Get a specific Fighter by ID.</br></br>**Note**: If you want to scrape the database I would recommend using the</br>`GET /api/fighter/` pagination endpoint instead.

schema.title: Id

get.description: List Matches in a paginated format.</br></br>The `fighter`, `fighter_blue`, `fighter_red`, and `winner` query parameters are the</br>ID of the associated Fighter in the database. In order to map the name of a fighter</br>to an ID use the `GET /api/fighter/` endpoint.

tags.description: Matches recorded by SaltyBoy. Only Tournament, and Matchmaking matches are recorded. Exhibition matches are not.
tags.name: Match

tags.description: Current match information. Mainly used to get detailed information about the current match by the SaltyBoy extension.
